titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania Ms. Codex 572: Proceedings of the inquisition in the Apostolic Palace in Rome.

msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts

msContents.summary: Copy of documents related to the inquisition in the 17th century, beginning with proceedings of the inquisition on 8 July 1660 [not 1610 as stated in Zacour-Hirsch Catalogue] (f. 1r-37v) and October 8, 1625 (f. 38r-40v); with a collection of papal constitutions of the 16th and 17th centuries dealing with the inquisition; and additional papal letters on various subjects (e.g., forbidding monks and nuns to make gifts (f. 41r-46r); "Dicliaratione della soprascritta costituione, "(an additional unpaginated signature bound in between f. 46 and f. 47); and decreti of the Holy Congregation on the celebration of the mass, ending with a letter signed Fran[cis]cus Card. Albanus (f. 47r-62v). At the end, a note "De excommunicatione" (f. 62v-64r); "Explicatione d'alcuni termini (f. 64r); privileges to the Capuchin order (f. 64v-66r); note in Latin on f. 66v dated 1701. Decrees, constitutions, and prohibitions on matters of doctrine apparently meant to be read aloud to congregations (occasional headnotes added later note the liturgical season in which the text is to be read).

msItem.title: Proceedings of the inquisition in the Apostolic Palace in Rome.

supportDesc.extent: 74 leaves : 194 x 132 (174 x 106) mm bound to 202 x 143 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Paper, 74; 1-46, [viii], 47-62, [63-66]; contemporary foliation in ink, upper right recto.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in a cursive script by a single hand.

history.provenance: Formerly owned by Sir Thomas Phillipps (no. 5740).
